intro: Psychotria incompta, commonly known as the "Coca plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly the Andean regions of Peru, Bolivia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It contains alkaloids, including cocaine, which have been used traditionally by indigenous peoples for various purposes. Due to its psychoactive properties, it is also subject to legal restrictions in many countries.
